title: Innovative Idea Wins Citi Sponsored Start-Up Business Competition at the AUBG
summary: A mobile phone application connecting people and creating networks based on similar interests and hobbies snatched the first prize at the student competition for business projects at the American University in Bulgaria (AUBG). With its innovative map visualization and 'heat spots' pinpointing events and activities, the application facilitates communication, the flow of information and localization of events of mutual interest. The panel of judges, a mix of academia and business representatives that included Stefan Felstein, Citi Country Officer Bulgaria, Michael Easton, President of the American University, a Junior Achievement (JA) representative and University alumni, had the difficult task of selecting the best business idea.
tag-1: Innovative Idea Wins Citi Sponsored Start-Up Business Competition at the AUBG
tag-2: A mobile phone application connecting people and creating networks based on similar interests and hobbies snatched the first prize at the student competition for business projects at the American University in Bulgaria (AUBG). With its innovative map visualization and 'heat spots' pinpointing events and activities, the application facilitates communication, the flow of information and localization of events of mutual interest. The panel of judges, a mix of academia and business representatives that included Stefan Felstein, Citi Country Officer Bulgaria, Michael Easton, President of the American University, a Junior Achievement (JA) representative and University alumni, had the difficult task of selecting the best business idea.
tag-3: More than 100 students and professors who attended the event also had the opportunity to vote for their favorite project. Their prize went to the team that had developed a health and fitness site that not only offered information on healthy lifestyles but provided individually tailored diet and fitness programs.
tag-4: The competition is part of the University entrepreneurship course for undergraduates, based on JA's enterprise start-up program and implemented with the funding support of Citibank Bulgaria. The program connects students with real business experience, providing them with a learning-by-doing opportunity and a test-start for innovative business ideas. Course participants form teams, brainstorm business ideas, write business plans and finalize them into business projects presented at the event. The students also are given the opportunity to pay onsite visits to successful businesses and gain hands-on experience.
tag-5: Veneta Andonova, business administration professor and program coordinator, says, "The program allows students to gain real business insight and network with successful entrepreneurs. This experience helps them turn their idea into a successful business enterprise and leads to a change in their way of thinking."

tag-9: American University in Bulgaria AUBG is a private American-style liberal arts university located in Blagoevgrad, Bulgaria. The University has assumed a unique and critical educational role in the dynamic region of Southeastern Europe through its emphasis on preparing students for leadership, community involvement, careers, and advanced study. AUBG is accredited both in the US and in Bulgaria. Courses are taught in English by a high-quality faculty coming from 4 continents, experienced in teaching in a multicultural, learner-centered environment. The highly talented international student body is open to knowledge and ready to grow intellectually, professionally, and personally. Currently, there are about 1100 students studying at AUBG, representing 30 countries. The success of the University is attested by its more than 2000 alumni from 30 countries who have already found their place in prestigious companies, started successfully their own business or have continued their education at an internationally renowned universities. For additional information please visit www.aubg.bg.
